member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.FromPlainText(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a document from a plain text string and optional language.
member.param: The text of the document. Must not be null.
The language of the document, as an ISO or BCP-47 language code. This may be empty or null (the default), in which case the language will be detected by the Natural Language service.
member.returns: The newly created document.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.FromHtml(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs a document from an HTML string and optional language.
member.param: The HTML text of the document. Must not be null.
The language of the document, as an ISO or BCP-47 language code. This may be empty or null (the default), in which case the language will be detected by the Natural Language service.
member.returns: The newly created document.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.Type
member.summary: Required. If the type is not set or is `TYPE_UNSPECIFIED`, returns an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.Content
member.summary: The content of the input in string format.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.GcsContentUri
member.summary: The Google Cloud Storage URI where the file content is located. This URI must be of the form: gs://bucket_name/object_name. For more details, see https://cloud.google.com/storage/docs/reference-uris. NOTE: Cloud Storage object versioning is not supported.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.Language
member.summary:
The language of the document (if not specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and BCP-47 language codes are accepted.
**Current Language Restrictions:** * Only English, Spanish, and Japanese textual content are supported, with the following additional restriction: * `analyzeSentiment` only supports English text. If the language (either specified by the caller or automatically detected) is not supported by the called API method, an `INVALID_ARGUMENT` error is returned.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.SourceOneofCase
member.summary: Enum of possible cases for the "source" oneof.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the Document message type.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Document.Types.Type.Unspecified
member.summary: The content type is not specified.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceReflection
member.summary: Holder for reflection information generated from google/cloud/language/v1/language_service.proto

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType
member.summary: Represents the text encoding that the caller uses to process the output. Providing an `EncodingType` is recommended because the API provides the beginning offsets for various outputs, such as tokens and mentions, and languages that natively use different text encodings may access offsets differently.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType.None
member.summary: If `EncodingType` is not specified, encoding-dependent information (such as `begin_offset`) will be set at `-1`.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType.Utf8
member.summary: Encoding-dependent information (such as `begin_offset`) is calculated based on the UTF-8 encoding of the input. C++ and Go are examples of languages that use this encoding natively.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType.Utf16
member.summary: Encoding-dependent information (such as `begin_offset`) is calculated based on the UTF-16 encoding of the input. Java and Javascript are examples of languages that use this encoding natively.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EncodingType.Utf32
member.summary: Encoding-dependent information (such as `begin_offset`) is calculated based on the UTF-32 encoding of the input. Python is an example of a language that uses this encoding natively.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Sentence
member.summary: Represents a sentence in the input document.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Sentence.Sentiment
member.summary: For calls to [AnalyzeSentiment][] or if [AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment][google.cloud.language.v1.AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment] is set to true, this field will contain the sentiment for the sentence.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity
member.summary: Represents a phrase in the text that is a known entity, such as a person, an organization, or location. The API associates information, such as salience and mentions, with entities.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Name
member.summary: The representative name for the entity.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Metadata
member.summary:
Metadata associated with the entity.
Currently, only Wikipedia URLs are provided, if available. The associated key is "wikipedia_url".

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Salience
member.summary:
The salience score associated with the entity in the [0, 1.0] range.
The salience score for an entity provides information about the importance or centrality of that entity to the entire document text. Scores closer to 0 are less salient, while scores closer to 1.0 are highly salient.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Mentions
member.summary: The mentions of this entity in the input document. The API currently supports proper noun mentions.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Entity.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the Entity message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Token
member.summary: Represents the smallest syntactic building block of the text.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Token.PartOfSpeech
member.summary: Parts of speech tag for this token.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Token.DependencyEdge
member.summary: Dependency tree parse for this token.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Sentiment
member.summary: Represents the feeling associated with the entire text or entities in the text.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Sentiment.Magnitude
member.summary: A non-negative number in the [0, +inf) range, which represents the absolute magnitude of sentiment regardless of polarity (positive or negative).

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.Sentiment.Score
member.summary: Sentiment score between -1.0 (negative sentiment) and 1.0 (positive sentiment.)

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech
member.summary: Represents part of speech information for a token.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the PartOfSpeech message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Tag
member.summary: The part of speech tags enum.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Aspect
member.summary: The characteristic of a verb that expresses time flow during an event.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Aspect.Unknown
member.summary: Aspect is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Case
member.summary: The grammatical function performed by a noun or pronoun in a phrase, clause, or sentence. In some languages, other parts of speech, such as adjective and determiner, take case inflection in agreement with the noun.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Case.Unknown
member.summary: Case is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Form
member.summary: Depending on the language, Form can be categorizing different forms of verbs, adjectives, adverbs, etc. For example, categorizing inflected endings of verbs and adjectives or distinguishing between short and long forms of adjectives and participles

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Form.Unknown
member.summary: Form is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Gender
member.summary: Gender classes of nouns reflected in the behaviour of associated words.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Gender.Unknown
member.summary: Gender is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Mood
member.summary: The grammatical feature of verbs, used for showing modality and attitude.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Mood.Unknown
member.summary: Mood is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Number.Unknown
member.summary: Number is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Person
member.summary: The distinction between the speaker, second person, third person, etc.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Person.Unknown
member.summary: Person is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Proper
member.summary: This category shows if the token is part of a proper name.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Proper.Unknown
member.summary: Proper is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Reciprocity.Unknown
member.summary: Reciprocity is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Tense.Unknown
member.summary: Tense is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Voice
member.summary: The relationship between the action that a verb expresses and the participants identified by its arguments.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.PartOfSpeech.Types.Voice.Unknown
member.summary: Voice is not applicable in the analyzed language or is not predicted.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge
member.summary: Represents dependency parse tree information for a token.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.HeadTokenIndex
member.summary: Represents the head of this token in the dependency tree. This is the index of the token which has an arc going to this token. The index is the position of the token in the array of tokens returned by the API method. If this token is a root token, then the `head_token_index` is its own index.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Label
member.summary: The parse label for the token.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the DependencyEdge message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label
member.summary: The parse label enum for the token.

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.Attr
member.summary: Attribute dependent of a copular verb

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.Ccomp
member.summary: Clausal complement of a verb or adjective

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.Goeswith
member.summary: Goes with (part of a word in a text not well edited)

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.Npadvmod
member.summary: Noun phrase used as an adverbial modifier

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.Pcomp
member.summary: The complement of a preposition is a clause

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.Pronl
member.summary: The relationship between a verb and verbal morpheme

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.Snum
member.summary: Suffix specifying a unit of number

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.Vmod
member.summary: Clause headed by an infinite form of the verb that modifies a noun

member.name: F:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.DependencyEdge.Types.Label.List
member.summary: List for chains of comparable items

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EntityMention
member.summary: Represents a mention for an entity in the text. Currently, proper noun mentions are supported.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EntityMention.Type
member.summary: The type of the entity mention.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.EntityMention.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the EntityMention message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.TextSpan
member.summary: Represents an output piece of text.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.TextSpan.Content
member.summary: The content of the output text.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.TextSpan.BeginOffset
member.summary: The API calculates the beginning offset of the content in the original document according to the [EncodingType][google.cloud.language.v1.EncodingType] specified in the API request.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeSentimentRequest.Document
member.summary: Input document. Currently, `analyzeSentiment` only supports English text ([Document.language][google.cloud.language.v1.Document.language]="EN").

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeSentimentRequest.EncodingType
member.summary: The encoding type used by the API to calculate sentence offsets.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeSentimentResponse.DocumentSentiment
member.summary: The overall sentiment of the input document.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeSentimentResponse.Language
member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See `Document.language` field for more details.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeSentimentResponse.Sentences
member.summary: The sentiment for all the sentences in the document.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeEntitiesRequest.EncodingType
member.summary: The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeEntitiesResponse.Entities
member.summary: The recognized entities in the input document.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeEntitiesResponse.Language
member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See `Document.language` field for more details.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeSyntaxRequest.EncodingType
member.summary: The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeSyntaxResponse.Tokens
member.summary: Tokens, along with their syntactic information, in the input document.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnalyzeSyntaxResponse.Language
member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See `Document.language` field for more details.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextRequest
member.summary: The request message for the text annotation API, which can perform multiple analysis types (sentiment, entities, and syntax) in one call.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextRequest.EncodingType
member.summary: The encoding type used by the API to calculate offsets.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextRequest.Types
member.summary: Container for nested types declared in the AnnotateTextRequest message type.

member.name: T:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextRequest.Types.Features
member.summary: All available features for sentiment, syntax, and semantic analysis. Setting each one to true will enable that specific analysis for the input.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextResponse.Sentences
member.summary: Sentences in the input document. Populated if the user enables [AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_syntax][google.cloud.language.v1.AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_syntax].

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextResponse.Tokens
member.summary: Tokens, along with their syntactic information, in the input document. Populated if the user enables [AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_syntax][google.cloud.language.v1.AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_syntax].

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextResponse.Entities
member.summary: Entities, along with their semantic information, in the input document. Populated if the user enables [AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entities][google.cloud.language.v1.AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_entities].

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextResponse.DocumentSentiment
member.summary: The overall sentiment for the document. Populated if the user enables [AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment][google.cloud.language.v1.AnnotateTextRequest.Features.extract_document_sentiment].

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.AnnotateTextResponse.Language
member.summary: The language of the text, which will be the same as the language specified in the request or, if not specified, the automatically-detected language. See `Document.language` field for more details.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.GetDefault
member.summary: Get a new instance of the default .
member.returns: A new instance of the default .

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.#ctor
member.summary: Constructs a new object with default settings.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.IdempotentRetryFilter
member.summary: The filter specifying which RPC s are eligible for retry for "Idempotent" RPC methods.
member.remarks: The eligible RPC s for retry for "Idempotent" RPC methods are:

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.NonIdempotentRetryFilter
member.summary: The filter specifying which RPC s are eligible for retry for "NonIdempotent" RPC methods.
member.remarks: There are no RPC s eligible for retry for "NonIdempotent" RPC methods.

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.GetDefaultRetryBackoff
member.returns: The "Default" retry backoff for RPC methods.
member.remarks:
The "Default" retry backoff for RPC methods is defined as:
Initial delay: 100 milliseconds
Maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Delay multiplier: 1.3

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.GetDefaultTimeoutBackoff
member.returns: The "Default" timeout backoff for RPC methods.
member.remarks:
The "Default" timeout backoff for RPC methods is defined as:
Initial timeout: 60000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Maximum timeout: 60000 milliseconds

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.AnalyzeSentimentSettings
member.summary: for synchronous and asynchronous calls to LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeSentiment and LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeSentimentAsync.
member.remarks:
The default LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeSentiment and LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeSentimentAsync are:
Initial retry delay: 100 milliseconds
Retry delay multiplier: 1.3
Retry maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Initial timeout: 60000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Timeout maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Retry will be attempted on the following response status codes:
Default RPC expiration is 600000 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.AnalyzeEntitiesSettings
member.summary: for synchronous and asynchronous calls to LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeEntities and LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeEntitiesAsync.

Initial retry delay: 100 milliseconds
Retry delay multiplier: 1.3
Retry maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Initial timeout: 60000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Timeout maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Retry will be attempted on the following response status codes:
Default RPC expiration is 600000 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.AnalyzeSyntaxSettings
member.summary: for synchronous and asynchronous calls to LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeSyntax and LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeSyntaxAsync.
member.remarks:
The default LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeSyntax and LanguageServiceClient.AnalyzeSyntaxAsync are:
Initial retry delay: 100 milliseconds
Retry delay multiplier: 1.3
Retry maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Initial timeout: 60000 milliseconds
Timeout multiplier: 1.0
Timeout maximum delay: 60000 milliseconds
Retry will be attempted on the following response status codes:
Default RPC expiration is 600000 milliseconds.

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceSettings.AnnotateTextSettings

member.name: P:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceClient.DefaultEndpoint

member.name: M:Google.Cloud.Language.V1.LanguageServiceClient.ShutdownDefaultChannelsAsync
member.summary: Shuts down any channels automatically created by and . Channels which weren't automatically created are not affected.
member.remarks: After calling this method, further calls to and will create new channels, which could in turn be shut down by another call to this method.
member.returns: A task representing the asynchronous shutdown operation.

member.param: Input document. Currently, `analyzeSentiment` only supports English text ([Document.language][google.cloud.language.v1.Document.language]="EN").
